top10_tweets_like:
I think we could all use some good news today. 

Did you know that @rstudio just got rainbow parentheses?

https://t.co/EEuiNIBiq2 

#rstats

{dbplyr} 2.0.0 is available now!
{dbplyr} is the database backend for {dplyr}. It allows you to use remote database tables as if they are in-memory data frames by automatically converting {dplyr} code into SQL.
Learn about the improvements at #tidyverse blog.
#RStats #DataScience https://t.co/5IMoibvay9 https://t.co/5ZZ0R8im4P

Want something to distract you from <everything going on>? Learn how to use #rstats to generate synthetic data to uncover causal effects with DAGs, RCTs, diff-in-diff, regression discontinuity (sharp and fuzzy!), and instrumental variables https://t.co/al3wEtV5op https://t.co/AeZBix6VhA

JOB: I'm hiring a data scientist to work on COVID-19 response at @EcoHealthNYC. This is high-impact work, building models and pipelines in #rstats to support policy advisory. Apply soon! Posting will be open 2 wks, we are looking to fill the position ASAP. https://t.co/DKE5ypVIZD

Polls can be wrong for lots of reasons: a biased sample, improper weighting or just plain sample variance.

The most common reason, tho, is that the universe hates you and wants you to be as miserable as possible before your inevitable death. #datascience #rstats #pydata

What working with bad code feels like. Sigh.
